Not really an example, I guess a minor PSA/heads-up for embedders

```shell
> RUSTFLAGS='-C panic=abort' cargo run -q --example=panik --
thread 'main' panicked at 'panik !!!', core/examples/panik.rs:24:5
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace

> RUSTFLAGS='-C panic=unwind' cargo run -q --example=panik --
```

title: feat: allow exiting on two consecutive ctrl+c presses
body:
<!--
Before submitting a PR, please read http://deno.land/manual/contributing

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(std/http): Fix race condition in server
    - docs(console): Update docstrings
    - feat(doc): Handle nested reexports

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. Ensure there is a related issue and it is referenced in the PR text.
3. Ensure there are tests that cover the changes.
4. Ensure `cargo test` passes.
5. Ensure `./tools/format.js` passes without changing files.
6. Ensure `./tools/lint.js` passes.
-->

Allow exiting the REPL by pressing ctrl+c twice consecutively.

For Node compat :^)

title: chore: update wpt
feat(npm): add support for --reload=npm: and --reload=npm:<package>
body:
Adds support for npm packages in --reload flag.

It causes the registry info and tarball to be downloaded again.

- "--reload=npm:" - reloads all npm packages
- "--reload=npm:<package>" - reloads only "<package>"

title: feat(npm): add flag for creating and resolving npm packages to a local node_modules folder
body:
This flag is for greater compatibility with packages that depend on a local node_modules folder existing.

1. Creates a local `node_modules` folder [pnpm style](https://pnpm.io/symlinked-node-modules-structure) -- Note: Missing peer dependency support for the first pass.
2. The node_modules folder is created in the same folder as the resolved deno.json or the cwd if it doesn't exist.

Note: We cannot symlink to the global cache because that will cause resolutions to resolve to the global cache. For now, it copies, but we could hardlink if on the same file system in the future.

- [x] Bikeshed on `--local-npm` name. Also, Bartek recommended this maybe be an env var. Edit: It's now `--node-modules-dir`

Closes #15822

title: fix(runtime): better error message with Deno.env.get/set
body:
This PR improves the error message when `Deno.env.get` is called with invalid inputs.

`Deno.env.get` throws an error if the input is an empty string or contains "\0" or "=", but the error message is always `Key contains invalid characters.`. This PR fixes this error message, and gives more information about the invalid inputs.

Partially resolves https://github.com/denoland/deno_std/issues/2665

title: fix(flash): panic if response if undefined
body:
Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/15939

## Merge on approval

title: perf(core): use single ObjectTemplate for ops in `initialize_ops`
body: Towards https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/15945

title: perf(cli): avoid `canonicalize_path` if config file does not exist
body: Towards #15945

title: perf(cli): use -O3 instead of -Oz
body:
Towards #15945

OS | Binary size (-Oz) | Binary size (-O3) 
---|---|---|
MacOS m1 | 91M | **85M** (reduction)
Linux x64 | 96M | **97M** (increase)

title: perf(cli): avoid `clap::App::clone`
body: Towards #15945

title: refactor: move out test files from root testdata directory into sub directories
body:
The testdata folder is a quiet messy and super large. Expanding it is not very nice in a tree view. Ideally tests would be structured like `testdata/<sub_command_or_category>/<test_name>/<files>`, but this PR is a start at moving more test files into sub directories. Progressively over time we can make it better.

Also, there's been some creep of tests ending up in mod.rs. I moved those out to the proper files.

### Merge on Approval and CI Pass

title: chore: fix clippy warnings
body:
Stop allowing clippy::derive-partial-eq-without-eq and fix warnings about deriving PartialEq without also deriving Eq.

In one case I removed the PartialEq because it a) wasn't necessary, and b) sketchy because it was comparing floating point numbers.

IMO, that's a good argument for enforcing the lint rule, because it would most likely have been caught during review if it had been enabled.

title: fix(doc): deno doc should parse modules if they haven't been parsed before
body:
Depends on https://github.com/denoland/deno_doc/pull/292

This is the same fix that we did with eszip and deno compile.

Closes #15930

title: perf(ext/console): avoid `wrapConsole` when not inspecting
body:
Fixes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/11932

3x improvement logging strings.

```
time deno run for.js > /dev/null

________________________________________________________
Executed in  308.64 millis    fish           external
   usr time  297.68 millis    0.24 millis  297.43 millis
   sys time   37.82 millis    1.63 millis   36.19 millis
```

```
time target/release/deno run for.js > /dev/null

________________________________________________________
Executed in  109.55 millis    fish           external
   usr time  104.32 millis  130.00 micros  104.19 millis
   sys time   33.39 millis  840.00 micros   32.55 millis
```

title: perf(web): optimize encodeInto()
body:
Towards https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/15895

- [x] Use a preallocated Uint32Array result buffer. Much more efficient then serializing an object.

- [x] Use `v8::String::write_utf8` directly on the backing store.

- [x] Use `v8::ArrayBuffer::data` instead of going through the backing store abstraction. See https://v8.github.io/api/head/classv8_1_1ArrayBuffer.html
  > More efficient shortcut for [GetBackingStore()](https://v8.github.io/api/head/classv8_1_1ArrayBuffer.html#aaa29e281f94990cbf0a5484140fffb50)->Data(). The returned pointer is valid as long as the [ArrayBuffer](https://v8.github.io/api/head/classv8_1_1ArrayBuffer.html) is alive.

  https://github.com/denoland/rusty_v8/pull/1068
  
5.4x faster encodeInto()

```
# This patch
target/release/deno run -A --unstable cli/bench/encode_into.js
time 78 ms rate 12820512
time 66 ms rate 15151515
time 65 ms rate 15384615
time 66 ms rate 15151515
```

```
# main
deno run -A --unstable cli/bench/encode_into.js
time 362 ms rate 2762430
time 340 ms rate 2941176
time 340 ms rate 2941176
time 339 ms rate 2949852
```

Revert "docs: remove unstable messages"

Reverts denoland/deno#15878

There is no way to tell if an API is stable or unstable in LSP completions now. docland should just ignore this specific comment if it is causing issues there.

Also no way to tell apart stable and unstable APIs in `deno types` output.

2. Create general use `NpmPackageResolver` that has an internal implementation that can be swapped out.

body:

title: fix(npm): align Deno importing Node cjs with Node esm importing cjs
body:
Unfortunately, I don't believe there would be any way for us to make the `__esModule`/`default` checks work in a bullet proof way given that we need to analyze named exports ahead of time. Making it work would also probably lead to a lot of complexity that static analysis would fail us on in certain scenarios which would lead to probably requiring exceptions for certain packages. See discussion in #15876.

Closes #15865

title: docs: remove unstable messages
body: Causes extreme noise on dotland built-in docs PR

title: perf: fs optimizations - part 1
body:
- [x] Flatten op arguments.
  
  As a result, `truncateSync` becomes 2.3x faster.
  ```
  # main
  () => truncateSync("test", 0)
  time 1029 ms rate 97181
  time 1013 ms rate 98716
  time 745 ms rate 134228
  
  # This patch
  () => truncateSync("test", 0)
  time 469 ms rate 213219
  time 447 ms rate 223713
  ```
- [x] ~8x faster way to serialize `op_stat_sync` result to JS.

  ```
  # main
  () => lstatSync("test")
  time 767 ms rate 130378
  time 767 ms rate 130378
  time 745 ms rate 134228
  
  # This patch
  () => lstatSync("test")
  time 99 ms rate 1010101
  time 99 ms rate 1010101
  time 98 ms rate 1020408
  ```
- [x] ~14x faster file copy on MacOS using APFS' `clonefile`

  ```
  # main
  () => copyFileSync("test", "test2")
  time 8646 ms rate 1156
  time 7578 ms rate 1319

  # This patch
  () => copyFileSync("test", "test2")
  time 738 ms rate 13550
  time 647 ms rate 15455
  ```
- [x] Fast path for `perms.read.check` / `perms.write.check` to avoid `resolve_from_cwd` when possible. It's quite literally a bool check when run with `-A`, making it infintely faster than before.

title: chore(runtime): upgrade netif crate
body:
v0.1.3 contains code that will stop working with newer versions of libstd because the layout of some std::net types changed.

Refs: https://github.com/bnoordhuis/netif/pull/10

<hr>

The linked PR is the only code change relative to v0.1.3.

title: perf(url): return early if url has no query string
body:
This small change returns early if the url being parsed has no query string. This gives a nice performance improvement when tested on Ubuntu 22.04 docker in unprivileged mode:

![Screenshot from 2022-09-10 23-50-54](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/159073/189504669-0bc45351-eff2-4b63-bec8-6cb50785a79c.png)

I ran wpt tests as follows and all are passing.

```
deno run -A --unstable ./tools/wpt.ts setup
deno run -A --unstable ./tools/wpt.ts run -- url
deno run -A --unstable ./tools/wpt.ts run --
```

I can't bench right now on Mac or Windows so if anyone can verify they can see same thing there, that would be great.

this is my first Deno PR so let me know if i have missed something out.

title: fix(npm): support cjs resolution of package subpath with package.json
body:
Supports resolving directories that have a package.json and main entry pointing at something that's not index.js/cjs/etc.

Closes #15840

title: fix(ext/webgpu): GPUDevice.features should be SetLike.
body: Fixes #15702.

title: fix(ext/flash): don't block requests
body:
Fixes #15758 

<details><summary>13% improvement in react-dom SSR</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34997667/189511797-d2846eb5-4138-4c9b-9374-6bb7f90ff115.png)

</details>

* slight ~3% decrease in Hono routing benchmark but there is a 14% overhead in `{ headers }` logic.
* no change in plaintext benchmark on OSX / Linux.

title: perf(ext/flash): remove string->buffer cache
body:
Removes an unecessary optimization: Apart from the possibility that the cache might explode due to uncertainties of timer callbacks, there is also a megamorphic property access hit which kinda cancels out its usefulness.

1.3x improvement on Linux. No change on OSX.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34997667/189491398-f0bd92df-c9c0-40ee-b51c-ccf3578ffc45.png)

title: fix(ops): Fix typo on readme
body:
# Description

This fixes the typo on `ops` README.

title: fix(npm): align Node esm code importing cjs with Node
body: This more aligns Node ESM importing CJS to have the same behaviour as Node, but keeps the current `__esModule` check that Deno does when importing CJS from npm. Essentially, this allows the Node ESM code to be comptabile with Node and the Deno code can be more comptable with what's done in the JS/TS ecosystem. That said, I suspect we may run into issues doing this though and may want to eventually align Deno's interop with Node's behaviour...

title: fix(npm): remove export binding to match node
body: Closes #15790

title: chore(cli): exclude npm registry data from crate package
body:
`cli/tests/testdata/npm/registry/` contains 22MB of data and that causes the error `max upload size is: 10485760` while publishing `deno` crate.

This PR excludes `cli/tests/testdata/npm/registry/` and avoids the upload error.

title: chore: bump url crate to 2.3.0
fix(core): opAsync leaks a promise on type error
body:
Two minor changes to `opAsync`:

1. Ops never return `maybeError` anymore. A type error is thrown directly, whereas synchronous errors from async ops are handled by rejecting the promise. Thus there's no need to check the return value.
2. If the async op throws, it would now leave the promise in the promise ring. We need to try-catch the error, remove the error and rethrow the error.

Refs: https://github.com/denoland/deno_std/pull/2585

title: perf(runtime): short-circuit `queue_async_op` for Poll::Ready
body:
A nearly 5-20x improvement for async I/O operations that happen in a single tick. 

## Benchmarks

7x improvement in `opAsync("op_nop_async")` 
```
# this patch
target/release/deno run -A --unstable cli/bench/async_ops.js
time 43 ms rate 2325581
time 29 ms rate 3448275
time 27 ms rate 3703703
time 28 ms rate 3571428
time 28 ms rate 3571428
time 27 ms rate 3703703
time 29 ms rate 3448275
time 27 ms rate 3703703
time 28 ms rate 3571428
```
```
# main
deno run -A --unstable cli/bench/async_ops.js
time 200 ms rate 500000
time 180 ms rate 555555
time 181 ms rate 552486
time 180 ms rate 555555
time 179 ms rate 558659
time 179 ms rate 558659
time 180 ms rate 555555
time 179 ms rate 558659
time 181 ms rate 552486
time 179 ms rate 558659
```

4x improvement in TCP Conn.write (where all packets sent in one write call)

```
# this patch
Requests/sec: 751865.43
Transfer/sec:     36.57MB
```
```
# main
Requests/sec: 229258.34
Transfer/sec:     11.15MB
```

title: chore: fix flaky stdout_write_all test
body:
Adds back the `TaskQueue` from https://github.com/denoland/deno/pull/15092/commits/724fdd49e86ab69a792df63e5e47ec16aecebb8c#diff-c8dd7698dbd5b1b3e293ad2c98df1903aadbd893d3332fec60b229f8a180ea73

Tokio's sempahore doesn't seem to always give permits out in the order they were requested.

Note that the AsyncRefCell was removed in #15747 and a semaphore was used which caused this issue.

Closes #15771

title: fix(ops): use qualified borrow in op macro
body:
Fix https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/15764

Use RefCell::borrow instead of state.borrow to avoid clash with std::borrow::Borrow

<!--
Before submitting a PR, please read http://deno.land/manual/contributing

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(std/http): Fix race condition in server
    - docs(console): Update docstrings
    - feat(doc): Handle nested reexports

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. Ensure there is a related issue and it is referenced in the PR text.
3. Ensure there are tests that cover the changes.
4. Ensure `cargo test` passes.
5. Ensure `./tools/format.js` passes without changing files.
6. Ensure `./tools/lint.js` passes.
-->

title: refactor: cleanup Node compatibility code
body:
- move errors related to Node compat from cli/node/errors.rs to "ext/node" crate
- remove dependency on "node_resolver" crate
- make some of structures private to the "cli/node" module

title: refactor(npm): reorganize remapping built-in Node modules to remote URLs
body:
Changes how built-in Node modules are mapped to polyfills
from "deno_std". Instead of intertwining this logic into Node
resolution logic, we map them to "NodeResolution::BuiltIn"
which are remapped to "deno_std" URLs in ProcState.

title: feat(ext/ffi): Support bool FFI type
body:
Setup support for bool types in FFI. This enables both slow and fast API calls using booleans, since Fast API supports boolean to bool bindings.

Support for bools is also added for statics and `Deno.UnsafePointerView`.

Tests also done and tested, so this should be pretty good as-is.

### Dynasmrt Fast API
Adapting Dynasmrt PR to support booleans should be as easy as marking `NativeType::Bool` to take the same path as `NativeType::U8`.

title: chore: update devcontainer configuration
body: https://github.com/denoland/deno/pull/15344/commits/8d4ef9ba1b906981a209f70dbdf405e7948ab0ec#r933469806

title: feat(info): add information about npm modules cache
body:
Add information about npm modules cache to "deno info"
subcommand.

title: fix(npm): add more context to errors when file doesn't exist
body: Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/15695

title: fix(cli): allow using file resource synchronously while being used async
body:
This attempts to clone file resources when being used asynchronously in order to allow using a file resource synchronously while it's potentially being used asynchronously. If the file resource cannot be cloned, then the existing behaviour will occur where this is not allowed.

Closes #15708
Closes #13409
Closes #15268

title: fix(npm): respect `latest` dist tag for getting current version
body:
We should respect the "latest" dist tag for getting the current version when no version requirement is provided.

Pointed out in #15739

title: fix(npm): correct exact matching of pre-release versions
body:
This broke with the re-write of the npm semver, but should be fixed now.

Will do a follow up PR for latest tag matching.

Closes #15739

title: fix(init): suppress info logs when using quiet mode
body:
Fixes #15740

title: chore: forward v1.25.1 release commit to main
body:
This is the release commit being forwarded back to main for 1.25.1

Please ensure:
- [ ] Everything looks ok in the PR
- [ ] The release has been published

To make edits to this PR:
```shell
git fetch upstream forward_v1.25.1 && git checkout -b forward_v1.25.1 upstream/forward_v1.25.1
```

Don't need this PR? Close it.

cc @bartlomieju

Bumped versions for 1.25.1

Please ensure:
- [x] Target branch is correct
- [x] Crate versions are bumped correctly
- [x] deno_std version is incremented in the code (see `cli/deno_std.rs`)
- [x] Releases.md is updated correctly

To make edits to this PR:
```shell
git fetch upstream release_1_25.1 && git checkout -b release_1_25.1 upstream/release_1_25.1
```

cc @bartlomieju

title: perf(ops): inline &[u8] arguments and enable fast API
fix(ext/ffi): Fix pointer types
body:
Some pointer types were mistakenly using `BigInt` which as the TS type, which doesn't really mean anything.

Also, the `"buffer"` arguments do also accept `null`.

title: refactor: extract out check code from emit
body:
Type checking and emitting are completely separate now, so this PR splits out the check code from emit.rs.

I didn't make any modifications to the logic. This is just a re-organization.

Closes #15535

title: fix(npm): ignore npm cache directory creation errors
body: Closes #15711.

title: fix(npm): ignore the unstable error in the lsp
body: Not an ideal fix, but this is temporary code until it's stabilized. I also didn't add any lsp tests because those will come later once we get better lsp support.

title: perf(ext/web): flatten op arguments for text_encoding
body:
Towards #14893 
 
 1.4x improvement in CSV parsing.

```
# Before

time deno run --allow-env --allow-read --allow-hrtime deno-csv-CSVReader.ts 500000-Records.csv
Read 500001 lines for 19.435 seconds

________________________________________________________
Executed in   19.50 secs    fish           external
   usr time   17.47 secs    9.85 millis   17.46 secs
   sys time    3.55 secs    2.47 millis    3.54 secs
```

```
# After

time ../../deno/target/release/deno run --allow-env --allow-read --allow-hrtime deno-csv-CSVReader.ts 500000-Records.csv
Read 500001 lines for 14.889 seconds

________________________________________________________
Executed in   14.99 secs    fish           external
   usr time   13.13 secs    7.14 millis   13.13 secs
   sys time    3.18 secs    2.50 millis    3.18 secs
```

title: feat(ops): support `v8::FastApiCallbackOptions`
fix(serde_v8): update bytes::Bytes layout assumptions
body: Fixes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/15566

title: feat(serde_v8): Support StringObject as unit enum variant
body:
Allow passing `v8::StringObject` as unit enum variant alongside `v8::String`.

`v8::StringObject` is currently treated as an object and fails due to `LengthMismatch`.

Not sure about using `to_string` instead of `try_from`.
`try_from` fails due to: `BadType { actual: "v8::data::Value", expected: "v8::data::String" }`

title: fix(npm): better node version and version requirement compatibility
body:
We initially used the `semver` crate as a first pass solution, but this PR adds way better node semver support.

Wrote an in-house solution so we can move fast fixing bugs and re-use some of the code for our npm specifiers. The npm specifiers use a stricter parser than the version requirements allowed in package.json files.

Closes #15600

title: chore(serde_v8): take mutable reference in `ToV8::to_v8`
body: Currently, its not possible to mutatate return value during serialization stage; which is required to support V8 external strings that take ownership of the bytes. Ideally, `to_v8` should take ownership but that doesn't seem possible. With this patch, you could use `Option::take` to take ownership (& leak) `ByteString`, etc inside `to_v8`.
